Posts.Content: I found the Tax much harder like everyone else no sickness but Day 3 onwards pains in joints - maybe made worse by the Zarzio though. Mouth is the worst for me. I did get an infection after the first cycle and had to be hospitalised. My legs feel heavy as well. Mouth very dry and furry. I use gel Clair which they prescribed which I do find helped a lot I also use a dilutes myrrh mouthwash once or twice a day which I buy from Neals Yard as a tincture and dilute with water. I had head and neck cancer 8 years ago and found the myrrh very good then. Just feel wiped out and tired most of the time and it seems to last a lot longer -at least a week or more whereas it only lasted about 5 days with the FEC. Also feet and toes quite numb with lots of dry skin. My face also turned red but I used Aveeno lotion on that which was soothing
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects info please

Posts.Content: It may sound strange to say but it's very comforting to know others are having the same experiences and helps me a lot in not feeling so isolated about it all.
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects info please

Posts.Content: I completed my treatment last feb - FEC-T,  lumpectomy , RT. Had bad skin reaction to RT and needed to go to Health Centre for dressings every other day. On Letrozole and first mamo OK. Frantic with worry as lots of itching around breast and scar in last 3 weeks much worse last week and have now discovered blotchy and hot rash around the RT area. Very uncomfortable and panicked yesterday and went to emergency out of hours GP. No temperature and no infection and ge thinks it looks like eczema. Gave been plastering with Sudo cream. Have appointment withBCN on Wednesday but still cant stop worrying.
Posts.Title: itchy nipple !

Posts.Content: Got home about 5 hours ago after my first FEC it all went through OK. I had a light lunch of some soup and have been drinking ginger ale and also water. Just started to feel a bit groggy and have come to bed. Bit nauseous and tired. Also feel a bit light headed if I move too quickly.
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks I have been given one to take 'before bedtime' and some to take tomorrow what is classed as 'bedtime ' for these purposes
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Sorry to ask but I am also a newbie although now on Day 9 of my first FEC, but what's a neddy ?   i have actually started to feel a bit normal today
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: hello everyone - having been cured of tonsil cancer which I had eight years ago I now find myself joining you here in the breast cancer group and about to start my first chemo session this Friday with the FEC-T regime. Because I had cancer previously I had to have a body scan so I have spent a very worried two weeks waiting for the result of that however last night I received a call from the consultant to say that the scan was clear. This was great news and now I have got my mojo back and ready to fight this demon again.I am going to have chemo first for eighteen weeks then if all goes to plan a lumpectomy then RT then tablets for 5 years. Thats the plan anyway. I am so glad to meet you all and be part of this group and look forward to all the advice and help to get me through the chemo.
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda thanks so much for this help I did suffer in the night however feel a bit brighter this morning and managed to eat some porridge as one of the pills has to be taken with food. I did think about phoning the emergency number about the sickness thanks for the tip about the other drug I will tell them about this when I next get the chance. Nina
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone well two days past my first FEC and its been really good reading everything. Still feeling groggy although the nausea is becoming more manageable. I have been given dexamethasone to take twice daily for 3 days and Metoclopramide to take three times a day. This is different than the ones I had when I last had chemo then it was Domperinon or something that sounded like champagne but obviously wasn't . They seem to be working OK but wear off about 5 am. Any thoughts or advice welcome. Also having daily injection for immunity. Realised I have a bit of a foggy brain and can't remember everything
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks Vonnie and mizz 59 it was really good to get your posts in my box as I have been feeling a bit down. My first FEC was last Friday so I guess that means I am on day Day 7 or 6 depending on which day you count as Day 1. First three days were Ok, I also took three days of Dex which finished on Monday. Yesterday and today I have probably been feeling quite lightheaded and a bit like I have bricks on my head. if I move too quickly I can be a bit dizzy. yesterday I was very tired and was in and out of sleep most of the day. I am still having a bit of nausea which I am managing with Metroclompramide and drinking ginger ale. I have checked my temperature and its normal. My mouth is sore but following my Head and Neck cancer I do have to wear a denture in my mouth and it is clearly not helping. I had my hair cut very short on Monday there are few itches but nothing much as yet. I have been driving but not very far literally just down the road to the supermarket not sure if I should really risk it too much. I am finding it really helpful to hear whats going on with everyone else and to hear the feedback from those of you have already been here. so Thanks.
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: It's good news indeed. I got my wig on Tuesday and friends have also given me lots of nice stretchy turbens. With FEC 2 next Friday today I have really noticed my hair starting to fall out. I keep putting the wig on but not sure if I will actually be brave enough to wear it out but I guess I will just have to. Oh Well !
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for your replies it's good to know that this community is always here. It's good to know there are other possibilities. Thank
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result

Posts.Content: It turns out that it is aStage 3 ductal apparently the most common sort. Chemotherapy and then surgery then RT. As this is the second time I have had cancer I have to have a CT scan. Tomorrow I have to go for a breast MRI can anyone tell me about this ? Will it be OK to go on my own ? What will happen ? I am terrified that it has spread everywhere so scared and apprehensive
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result

Posts.Content: Eight years ago I had tonsil cancer and am already involved with the head and neck cancer group on here. I have successfully survived that however the scare of cancer and all I went through the first time has had the effect of stopping me from examining other parts of my body and now I have a breast lump. I dont know how long it has been there and I am petrified that it has been there a long time and could have spread so much it is untreatable. This week I went to the hospital and they did a cone biopsy and I get the results next Thursday. They couldnt say for certain what it was until they get the tests back but having been here once I am scared and cant believe I can get cancer twice. I would just be grateful for any words of support at the moment. I have had huge support from this community for my first cancer. I know I am thinking the worst but I watched it all on the ultrasound and it looked awful.
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result

Posts.Content: Oh I realised I have got it wrong about the Stage it's actually Grade 3 not Stage 3
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for your continuing support. I got through the MRI with. Friend waiting outside. It wasn't easy as I still have a dry mouth due to the RT with my previous cancer so I was convinced that my throat would get really dry and I would need water but I didn't. I have the CT scan next week I am scaring myself because I am imagining the worse. The consultant rang me on Thursday two days after the MRI and said they are going ahead with the original plan of chemo first. The one thing she did say which I could do with hearing about was that she would need to see me before starting chemo to put a clip into the lump so that she could mark where it is in case it disappeared during the chemo. I have got the oncology appointment yet but should getbthisvwithin a week. I also have a further appointment on 28 th with consultant. Trying to stay calm but it's all very difficult. Nina
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result

Posts.Content: I had my first docetaxol three weeks ago with my next on Friday. It was awful terrible pains in legs which I couldn't stop with paracetamol or ibruprofen and ended up in hospital for four days with an infection in my throat and mouth and the lowest blood count ever. Had to have intravenous fluids electrolytes and antibiotics. Also my hands went red and itchy and now are lizard like as the skin has started to peel. Only just starting to feel OK but have next one on Friday really dreading it although they have said they are going to reduce the dose a bit. It's horrible you have my sympathy. X
Posts.Title: Docytexal
